intro: Macrosolen annamicus, commonly known as the Annamite mistletoe, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to habitat loss, Macrosolen annamicus is considered vulnerable and is of interest in botanical conservation efforts.
